Hemorrhage is not a disease per se, but rather a symptom or complication of certain medical conditions. However, in this context, it seems to be used to describe a particular phenotype (observable trait) of the pituitary glands.

Therefore, the main disease-related entities in the paragraph are not explicitly mentioned. However, the text suggests that some genes may be involved in regulating both the massive pituitary glands (possibly a symptom of a disease) and the hemorrhagic phenotype.
